intro: Stephanophysum molle, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in arid landscapes.
